title: why rehab
text:
library(devtools)

Loading required package: usethis

library(tidyverse, tidycensus)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4

✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)


Attaching package: 'plotly'

The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    last_plot

The following object is masked from 'package:stats':

    filter

The following object is masked from 'package:graphics':

    layout

library(pak)
library(cmapplot)

cmapplot has registered the following fonts for use in this R session:
   Whitney Semibold, Whitney Medium, Whitney Book
cmapplot requires RStudio to use Whitney fonts in the R plots window.
    Please install RStudio. <https://www.rstudio.com>







county2014 <- read_csv(".\\inputs\\CDS\\County_2014.csv")

Rows: 7 Columns: 151
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (27): MUNI, RES_NAICS1_TYPE, RES_NAICS2_TYPE, RES_NAICS3_TYPE, RES_NAIC...
dbl (124): INC_LT_25K, INC_25_50K, INC_50_75K, INC_75_100K, INC_100_150K, IN...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

county2014 <- county2014 %>%
  add_column(year = 2014) %>%
  rename(GEOG = MUNI) %>%
  select(GEOG,  # GEO
         MEDINC,   # MEDIAN INCOME
         HU_TOT:HU_GT_5UN,  # HOUSING UNITS AND TYPE
         TOT_POP,  # POPULATION
         MED_HV,   # MEDIAN HOME VALUE
         TOT_HH,   # TOTAL HOUSEHOLDS
         OWN_OCC_HU,  # OWNER OCCUPIED
         RNT_OCC_HU,  # RENTER OCCUPIED
         VAC_HU,  # VACANT UNITS
         MED_AGE,   # MEDIAN AGE
         year)%>%  # year
    relocate(year,
             .after = GEOG
    ) %>%
  rename(RENT_OCC_HU = RNT_OCC_HU)





county2015 <- read_csv(".\\inputs\\CDS\\County_2015.csv")

Rows: 8 Columns: 239
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (62): CNTY, RES_NAICS1_TYPE, RES_NAICS2_TYPE, RES_NAICS3_TYPE, RES_NAIC...

ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

         HU_SNG_DET,
         HU_SNG_ATT,
         HU_2UN,
         HU_3_4UN,

         TOT_POP,  # POPULATION
         MED_HV,   # MEDIAN HOME VALUE
         TOT_HH,   # TOTAL HOUSEHOLDS
         OWN_OCC_HU,  # OWNER OCCUPIED
         RENT_OCC_HU,  # RENTER OCCUPIED
         VAC_HU,  # VACANT UNITS
         MED_AGE,   # MEDIAN AGE
         year)%>%  # year
    relocate(year,
             .after = GEOG
    )

county2014 <- county2014 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2015 <- county2015 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2016 <- county2016 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2017 <- county2017 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2018 <- county2018 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2019 <- county2019 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2020 <- county2020 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2021 <- county2021 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN)) 


county2022 <- county2022 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN))  


county2023 <- county2023 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN)) 


county2024 <- county2024 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN)) 





county <- bind_rows(county2014,
          county2015,
          county2016,
          county2017,
          county2018,
          county2019,
          county2020,
          county2021,
          county2022,
          county2023,
          county2024)

county <- county %>%
  mutate(GEOG = str_replace(GEOG, "CMAP Region", "Region")) %>%
  mutate(vac_rate = ((VAC_HU/HU_TOT)*100))





inflation <- read_csv(".\\inputs\\inflation.csv")

New names:
Rows: 15 Columns: 5
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(2): period, periodName dbl (3): ...1, year, value
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`

county <- county %>%
  full_join(inflation, join_by(year == year)) %>%
  rename(inflationfac = value) %>%
  mutate(infl2024 = 313.689/inflationfac) %>% #313.689 is the 2024 inflation factor 
  mutate(medincome_adjust = infl2024 *MEDINC) %>%
  mutate(medhv_adjust = infl2024 * MED_HV)





county <- county %>%
  mutate(stock_hh = HU_TOT / TOT_HH)

title: why rehab

         MED_HV,   # MEDIAN HOME VALUE
         TOT_HH,   # TOTAL HOUSEHOLDS

         RENT_OCC_HU,  # RENTER OCCUPIED

         MED_AGE,   # MEDIAN AGE
         year)%>%  # year
    relocate(year,
             .after = GEOG
    )

title: why rehab
text:
county2014 <- county2014 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2015 <- county2015 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2016 <- county2016 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2017 <- county2017 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2018 <- county2018 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2019 <- county2019 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2020 <- county2020 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_GT_5UN)) 


county2021 <- county2021 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN)) 


county2022 <- county2022 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN))  


county2023 <- county2023 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN)) 


county2024 <- county2024 %>%
  mutate(single_fam = (HU_SNG_DET + HU_SNG_ATT),
         multi_fam = (HU_2UN + HU_3_4UN + HU_5_9UN +
                        HU_10_19UN + HU_GT_19UN))

title: why rehab
text:
county <- bind_rows(county2014,
          county2015,
          county2016,
          county2017,
          county2018,
          county2019,
          county2020,
          county2021,
          county2022,
          county2023,
          county2024)

county <- county %>%
  mutate(GEOG = str_replace(GEOG, "CMAP Region", "Region")) %>%
  mutate(vac_rate = ((VAC_HU/HU_TOT)*100))

title: why rehab
text:
inflation <- read_csv(".\\inputs\\inflation.csv")

New names:
Rows: 15 Columns: 5
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(2): period, periodName dbl (3): ...1, year, value
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`

county <- county %>%
  full_join(inflation, join_by(year == year)) %>%
  rename(inflationfac = value) %>%
  mutate(infl2024 = 313.689/inflationfac) %>% #313.689 is the 2024 inflation factor 
  mutate(medincome_adjust = infl2024 *MEDINC) %>%
  mutate(medhv_adjust = infl2024 * MED_HV)
